result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert E Brandon

records.addlTxt:
Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Robert E Brandon in court.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Robert E Brandon.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not be on High Ridge Trl in Fitchburg. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MJG Jr, SJG, JBR, or PBR IV.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/2/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

2:33 PM Defendant Robert E Brandon in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Robert E Brandon.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense argument for sig bond. State objecting with argument. CT: modifies to $500 sig bond.  All other conditions remain as previously set.
Adam Welch on behalf of the DE
Bail/bond hearing on September 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

2:34 PM Defendant Robert E Brandon in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon and Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.   DE waived rights to atty for today's hearing only. Waiver signed. Court finds he waived freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.   State calls Law Enforcement, duly sworn. Direct by ADA Lennon. Witness id'd DE.  State moves for bindover, reserves for rebuttal.   No argument by DE. Court finds PC to bind case over.  Arraignment to be held in trial branch. Bail cont.
Defendant, pro se in letter format

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not be on High Ridge Trl in Fitchburg. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MJG Jr, SJG, JBR, or PBR IV.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17

4:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert E Brandon in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Robert E Brandon. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
